H0.text: Compass is the tool needed to measure the different angles of a ramp that is changed several times during an experiment.

H1.text: A protractor is the tool needed to measure the different angles of a ramp that is changed several times during an experiment.

H2.text: Meter stick is the tool needed to measure the different angles of a ramp that are changed several times during an experiment.

H3.text: Spring scale is the tool needed to measure the different angles of a ramp that is changed several times during an experiment.

A4.text: A protractor is a measuring instrument, typically made of transparent plastic, for measuring angles.

A5.text: The bevel protractor is used to establish and test angles to very close tolerances.
